criteria: Ability to identify claims made about dietary supplements and popular diets.
Ability to evaluate the accuracy of claims using credible sources and evidence.
Critical thinking and reasoning applied to the evaluation of claims.
descriptions: Does not identify any claims or misinterprets information.
Identifies claims, but struggles to accurately represent them.
Identifies some claims and represents them with limited accuracy.
Identifies most claims and represents them with reasonable accuracy.
Identifies nearly all claims and represents them accurately.
Identifies all claims accurately and provides a comprehensive summary of the information presented.
Unable to use credible sources to evaluate the accuracy of claims.
Attempts to use sources, but struggles to find credible information.
Uses sources, but the information provided has limited relevance.
Uses relevant sources to evaluate the claims, but some information is missing.
Uses relevant sources to evaluate claims accurately and comprehensively.
Uses relevant sources and synthesizes information accurately and comprehensively.
Displays no critical thinking or reasoning skills.
Displays limited critical thinking or reasoning skills.
Displays some critical thinking and reasoning skills, but lacks depth.
Displays solid critical thinking and reasoning skills, and shows understanding of the evaluation.
Displays strong critical thinking and reasoning skills with a solid and accurate understanding of the evaluation.
Displays exceptional critical thinking and reasoning skills, with clear, insightful, and accurate understanding of the evaluation.
